intro: Thlaspi saxatile, commonly known as rock cress, is a flowering plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is a small, perennial herb that typically grows in rocky or alpine environments. The plant features basal leaves that are lobed or divided, and its flowers are small, white or pale yellow, arranged in racemes. It produces round, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Thlaspi saxatile is often found in arctic and alpine regions across Europe, Asia, and North America.
